fields.description: Snapshots are supposed to be immutable and read only, so the EZ settings which in a snapshot path shouldn't change when the origin encryption zone changes.
fields.summary: Snapshotted encryption zone information should be immutable

comments.body:
For example:
1. make dir
2. take a snapshot
3. create EncryptionZone
4. {{getEncryptionZoneForPath}} on the snapshot path should return {{null}}, not {{EncryptionZone}} as in current implementation.

This patch fix that issue, the related unit test such as {{TestEncryptionZones}}, {{TestReencryption}},
 {{TestReencryptionHandler}}, {{TestReencryptionWithKMS}} succeeded in my local server. Please kindly review it.

This message was automatically generated.
Hi [~xiaochen], would you please help to review this? Many thanks.
Thanks for the ping, sorry I was in various things and did not find cycles for upstream reviews. I should be able to review this early next week.
[~xiaochen] It's fine, thank you for your willingness to review this.

Thanks for creating the jira and fixing it, [~GeLiXin].

Was able to do a preliminary review, some comments:
- Any reason to do {{isEqual}} here rather than the canonical override {{equals}} ?
- The new {{readINodeXAttrByPrefixedName}} method seems unnecessary - I think we can reuse the existing method which takes an iip and does {{iip.getPathSnapshotId()}} internally
- getEncryptionZoneForPath: Encryption zones can only be on Dirs, so no point in trying to get an ezi when it's not a dir.
- getEncryptionZoneForPath: I suspect the nullity check is related to some snapshot behavior - could you please add some comments?

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~GeLiXin] for revving.

The explanation about the new method and null check makes sense. Sorry I didn't look carefully in the previous review.

I didn't notice CipherSuite and CryptoProtocolVersion classes are enum. Looking at the variable field {{unknownValue}}, I think we should go with the default Enum#equals comparison. The unknown value was added by HDFS-6605 and the comparison should only care about the actual enum values.

Some other comments:
 - We can use {{HashCodeBuilder}} and {{EqualsBuilder}} to implement the EZI equals method.
 - EZI#getEncryptionZoneForPath: Since snapshot is a special case, can we still use the existing logic to get from {{encryptionZones}} if {{iip.getPathSnapshotId() == Snapshot.CURRENT_STATE_ID}}?
 - In the new method, parameter name typo 'sanpshotId'.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

Thanks for revving [~GeLiXin]. Latest patch looks pretty good. +1 pending 1 comment:

We can reduce some duplication between the 2 {{XAttrStorage#readINodeXAttrByPrefixedName}} methods. Can have the method that takes iip to call the method with inode and snapshotId, something like {{return readINodeXAttrByPrefixedName(iip.getLastINode(), iip.getPathSnapshotId(), prefixedName);}}. (javadoc of that method look stale too, would be good to clean it up while you're at it.)

[~xiaochen] Many thanks for your review. 

bq. We can reduce some duplication between the 2 XAttrStorage#readINodeXAttrByPrefixedName methods. 
That's sounds great. I have reconsituted the 2 similar {{XAttrStorage#readINodeXAttrByPrefixedName}} methods, besides the 2  {{FSDirXAttrOp#unprotectedGetXAttrByPrefixedName}} methods, actually there is no new method in the last patch now.
